intro: Microsorum papyraceum, commonly known as the Japanese water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically 10–30 cm in length and have a papery texture. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments and is often found in marshes and ponds. Its rhizomes form dense mats that help stabilize the substrate and provide habitat for aquatic life. Microsorum papyraceum is popular in water gardens and aquariums due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of maintenance.
